result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholaus Jay Erickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Absolute Sobriety. 
Not to have contact with known users/dealers except as necessary for treatment or in a confinement setting. 
Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
Must follow thru with current AODA.
Must follow thru with domestic violence assessment.

Must follow counseling, rules, treatment per the agent.
Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$290.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

21CF346-Count 1-fel poss meth-w/h, probation up to 3 yrs. 180 days CT, subj to WR, no GT-stayed. AS, Must cont to follow thru w/ current AODA. NC w/ users, must follow thru w/ dom violence assessment, follow counseling, rules of supervision. 30 days to provide sentence credit. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. Must report to probation today.

May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. Must report to probation today.

21CF379-Count 3-D/C-I&S 9 mo PCJ, subj to WR & GT. Probation 2 yrs. AS, Must cont to follow thru w/ current AODA. NC w/ users, must follow thru w/ dom violence assessment, follow counseling, rules of supervision. 1 day credit DNA sample, $200 surcharge, $100 dom surcharge, $265.60 fine. 60 dtp or set pp, ftp-judgment. May not possess or use firearms. Must report to probation today.
